description: Internal repairs and alterations as detailed and identified in the following documents forming part of this application:- *Heritage Statement with Planning Statement Issue No. 3 dated April 2023 prepared by Mark Strawbridge MRTPI IHBC FRSA FPHS *AM (Anna Monich) Scope of Works at 2nd and 3rd Floor at Flat 3, 3 Queens Gate, London SW7 - identifying the full extent of the proposed works *Schedule of Repairs / Renewals identifying the intended works to each existing window and door within the application property *Location Plan *380.S.01C - plans of existing identifying and numbering each of the existing windows and doors as referred to in other documents forming part of this application *380.S.02 - plans as proposed identifying the areas of skirting to be repaired and renewed and the method of the repair / renewal *380.S.03 - plans as proposed identifying the areas of cornice to be replaced like for like as it is not suitable for repair. The Heritage Statement provides further information and details in this regard *380.S.011 - plans as proposed identifying the double door that is to be reduced to a single door and confirming that all existing radiators (all are non-original) to be replaced with Enderby steel radiators within the same positions as the existing radiators *Structural report on 2nd and 3rd Floor Slopes at Flat 3, 3 Queens Gate, London SW7 dated 3rd July 2023 prepared by Philip Deane BE, Ceng, MICE, MIStructE of Philip Deane Associates showing the method of repair to the existing sloping floor and identifying the areas this applies to Enderby Steel Radiators product brochure *Document titled "Heritage Review" by Period Mouldings Limited dated 8th February 2023 confirming the skirting boards, architraves, internal doors to be installed as noted on the drawings forming part of this application *AM (Anna Monich) Design Presentation confirming the finishes, kitchen layout, bathroom layouts and sanitary fittings *F3.AM.01 - proposed 2nd and 3rd floor electrical plans  *Paxton Restoration Window Condition Survey Report and draught-proofing details dated March 2023 confirming the intended repair / renewal works to the existing windows as identified on the plans and Schedule of Repairs / Renewals forming part of this application
